intro: Bufonia gottelandii, commonly known as the Gotland bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the island of Gotland in Sweden. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and thrives in open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. Bufonia gottelandii is a perennial herb with a short, erect stem and lance-shaped leaves. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora and a subject of ecological study.
